FwkSenCnt.MEANING: the chief steward in a big household

ExCnt.EX: He informed me, in the blandest manner, that his eminence had himself given his instructions about me to his majordomo, that I would have a lodging in the cardinal's palace, that I would have my meals at the secretaries ' table, and that, until I learned French, I would have nothing to do but make extracts from letters that he would supply me with.

He ran away with her to Rome, where, after one year of imprisonment, the pope, Martin III., released Anna from her vows, and gave them the nuptial blessing at the instance of Don Juan Casanova, majordomo of the Vatican, and uncle of Don Jacob.
`Of course you must be admitted to His Lordship,' burbled the majordomo.
